intro: Hibbertia strigosa, commonly known as the rough hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers with red centers. The plant has rough, hairy leaves that are opposite in arrangement, and it typically grows in dry, sandy soils. Hibbertia strigosa is often found in heathlands and open forests, thriving in full sun. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens in suitable climates.
